alert.note: Alert for Bee; Coastal Aransas; Coastal Calhoun; Coastal Kleberg; Coastal Nueces; Coastal Refugio; Coastal San Patricio; Duval; Goliad; Inland Calhoun; Inland Kleberg; Inland Nueces; Inland Refugio; Inland San Patricio; Jim Wells; La Salle; Live Oak; McMullen; Victoria; Webb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 06 at 3:08AM CDT until April 07 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Critical Fire Danger Conditions This Afternoon and Early Evening for South Texas... ...Critical Fire Danger Conditions Possible Late Thursday Morning into Early Thursday Evening... A frontal boundary will move through South Texas this morning, bringing much drier air to the region. North winds of 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph will occur in the afternoon. The relative humidity values will fall to around 15 percent over the Brush Country to 20 to 30 percent over the coastal plains resulting in a Critical Fire Danger conditions for all of south Texas except the islands. Even drier on Thursday with relative humidity in the single digits across the Brush Country and Rio Grande Plains, falling to below 25 percent over all of South Texas has led to a Fire Weather Watch. Although winds will be slightly weaker on Thursday, around 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND VERY LOW HUMIDITY FOR SOUTH TEXAS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR VERY LOW HUMIDITY AND MODERATE TO STRONG WINDS FOR SOUTH TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Corpus Christi has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...La Salle...McMullen...Live Oak...Bee... Goliad...Victoria...Webb...Duval...Jim Wells...Inland Kleberg...Inland Nueces...Inland San Patricio...Coastal Aransas...Inland Refugio...Inland Calhoun...Coastal Kleberg... Coastal Nueces...Coastal San Patricio...Coastal Refugio... Coastal Calhoun. * TIMING...From 1 PM Today until 8 PM tonight for the Red Flag Warning. From 10 AM Thursday to 7 PM Thursday for the Fire Weather Watch. * WIND...North at 20 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph today, then 15 to 20 mph with gusts to 25 mph on Thursday. * HUMIDITY...Minimum values around 15 percent in the Brush Country to 20 to 30 percent for the coastal region today, then down to 7 to 10 percent over the Brush Country to around 15 to 20 percent over the Coastal Bend on Thursday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Residents are urged to exercise care with respect to all outdoor activities that could inadvertently cause wildfires. Report wildfires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
